definition: the whole family
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
variant of 舉|举[ju3]

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]

sentences.english: And so my family moved to a tiny town high up in the mountains outside Denver.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我们举家迁往丹佛市外深山高岭中的一座小镇。

sentences.english: John Fung was born in Madagascar, Africa. His family moved back to Hong Kong when he was 13.
sentences.chinese: 冯建中，出生于非洲马达加斯家岛，十三岁举家回港。

sentences.english: they even have days that you can get in for free for family revisiting and you can go in.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是举家再访，有时候你甚至能免费进去。

sentences.english: In 1932 his family moved to Lions Park, Suzhou, network, painting with great concentration.
sentences.chinese: 1932年举家移居苏州网狮园，潜心作画。

sentences.english: Anybody in Cuba can get Miami on his radio.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽出生在古巴，两岁时举家搬迁到迈阿密市。

definition: to migrate/to move to a new place of residence
to move (from one residence to another)
to settle (in some city, country etc)/to take up residence
to take all one's family along (idiom); encumbered by a family/tied down by family obligations
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
accompanied by one's dependents/encumbered by wife and children
dragged down by having a family to feed
to move away/to change residence
to live far away from one's native place/to reside in a foreign country
to run away from trouble/to flee from calamity/to be a refugee
whole family
to seek knowledge/to study/to attend college
to settle down/to set up a home
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote
refuge/to take refuge/to seek asylum (political etc)
ancestral home (town)/birthplace
